intro: Eriocaulon martianum, commonly known as Martian sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowering structures are usually green or reddish, and it produces small, three-lobed seeds. Eriocaulon martianum is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
